taskDescription: Drag and drop the words to the correct definitions.
empty: La zona de colocación @index está vacía.
contains: la zona de colocación @index contiene elemento @draggable.
ariaDraggableIndex: @index de @count elementos que se pueden colocar.
resetDropDescription: ¿Seguro que quieres restablecer esta zona de colocación?
grabbed: Has cogido el elemento a arrastrar.
scoreBarLabel: Has obtenido :num de un total de :total puntos
a11yCheck: Comprueba las respuestas. Las respuestas se marcarán como correctas, incorrectas o sin respuesta.
a11yShowSolution: Mostrar la solución. El trabajo será calificado con su solución correcta.
a11yRetry: Vuelve a intentar la tarea. Borra todas tus respuestas y empieza de nuevo.
textField:
*Raw Materials* They are unprocessed materials. Logs from trees are one example. They are processed by being sawn and then they become lumber.
,
*Water* All living creatures need this to survive. Animals and humans need this for drinking and cleaning.
,
*Food* Plants are the producers of much of this. Plants feed animals and people.
,
*Fibres* These are like hair and can be spun into a thread of rope which can then be woven, knitted or bound.
,
*Timbers* Wood is the material in its natural state. Wood is the hard, fibrous structural tissue. This is the name for wood after it had been modified by man.
,
*Metals* They are found in almost all rocks and soils and are an important part of our planet.
